body:
Which version of rclone are you using?  Have you tried [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org)?

I don't understand why sharepoint is returning "404" on the PROPFIND of the file - any ideas?

This might work as a work-around

    rclone ls --include /my.mp3 od1:song/
    rclone copy --include /my.mp3 od1:song/ ./mylocal

@ncw 
Run cmd:  rclone --dump headers --log-level DEBUG ls od1:song/my.mp3:
DEBUG : PROPFIND /personal/xxx_xxx_edu/Documents/song/my.mp3 HTTP/1.1
Host: xxx-my.sharepoint.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.42-060
Cookie: xxx
Depth: 1
Accept-Encoding: gzip
<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
RESPONSE:  HTTP/1.1 404 NOT FOUND

Then I use postman tool to test ：
PROPFIND  https://xxx-my.sharepoint.com/personal/xxx_xxx_edu/Documents/song/my.mp3
Depth: 0
<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
RESPONSE: HTTP/1.1 207 MULTI-STATUS,  and response detail info for my.mp3 file

So only change "Depth: 1" to "Depth: 0" in http header can make sharepoint webdav response normal.
I can do some testing， But i don't know how to fix it,  can you help me ?
I'll look into it in a few hours. Thanks for the testing with postman. That makes it a lot easier for me.

issue.title: webdav: sharepoint recursion with different depth

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
this change adds the depth parameter to listAll and readMetaDataForPath.
this allows recursive calls of these methods with a different depth
header.

Sharepoint won't list files if the depth header is != 0. If that is the
case, it will just return a error 404 although the file exists.
Since it is not possible to determine if a path should be a file or a
directory, rclone has to make a request with depth = 1 first. On success
we are sure that the path is a directory and the listing will work.
If this request returns error 404, the path either doesn't exist or it
is a file.
To be sure, we can try again with depth set to 0. If it still fails, the
path really doesn't exist, else we found our file.

fixes #2426

body:
@xiaolei0125 
I just pushed my changes to https://github.com/hensur/rclone/tree/sharepoint-webdav-2436

If you have a 64-bit linux, here is a binary with these changes: https://mirror.hensur.de/rclone

Or you can compile it yourself:
```
go get github.com/ncw/rclone
cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/ncw/rclone
git remote add sharepoint https://github.com/hensur/rclone
git checkout sharepoint/sharepoint-webdav-2436
go build
```
I hope these instructions work, the binary should then be in the current directory.

@hensur ，  Thank you for helping me fix it.

I have test it with this command:
```
rclone ls od1:song/my.mp3
rclone copy od1:song/my.mp3 ./mylocal
```
Both command work fine with sharepiont webdav.

Thank you, Will these codes be merged into github.com/ncw/rclone ？
@hensur - excellent work!  Will take a look at the PR over the weekend (at  gopherconuk at the momen!)

@hensur，Your fix did solve my problem,  rclone command, such as ls, copy from local to sharepoint , or copy from sharepoint to local are work fine.

@ncw  There is another issue that can't upload file about rclone serve webdav(sharepoint) and windows 10 webclient(a built-in map network driver as webdav client),   But  some other webdav client  I have tested, are work fine with rclone serve webdav(sharepoint).

I think this issue has nothing to do with hensur's fix,  even with rclone serve webdav.  
I posted it here, just want to let more people know.

Run "rclone serve webdav --vfs-cache-mode writes od1:song/ " as a webdav server, 
Then map network driver(webdav)  in windows 10,  upload file to sharepoint failed: 
```
DEBUG : webdav root '': File to upload is small (0 bytes), uploading instead of streaming
DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc420660c00)
DEBUG : PUT /personal/xxx_xxx_edu/Documents/song/my.mp3 HTTP/1.1
Host: xxx-my.sharepoint.com
Content-Length: 0
DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc420660c00)
DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Transfer-Encoding: chunked  
```
I test and found use "Content-Length: 0" in PUT header to sharepoint, sharepoint just reponse "200 OK" and not really creating a file, then use PROPFIND for new uploaded file, sharepoint just reponse "404 NOT FOUND" .  
So what confuses me is why windows 10 webdav client cause "rclone serve webdav" can't get file size?    

But use Android webdav client(ES FileExplore or Solid Explore) with rclone serve webdav,  it upload file 
 to sharepoint success, and rclone serve webdav can get file size normally.
```
DEBUG : webdav root '': Target remote doesn't support streaming uploads, creating temporary local FS to spool file
DEBUG : my.mp3: Sizes identical
DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc4202d0400)
DEBUG : PUT /personal/xxx_xxx_edu/Documents/song/my.mp3 HTTP/1.1
Host: xxx-my.sharepoint.com
Content-Length: 3898990
DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc4202d0400)
DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 201 CREATED
```

So only use "Content-Length: size" with actual file size in PUT header, sharepoint will reponse "201 CREATED" and creating a file success.
